website_summaries.verdict: Limited to string instruments like guitar or ukulele, but delivers accurate tuning very discreetly during performances.
pros: Clip-on head stock attachment is very secure
Strong back-lit display for low light performance situations
cons: Quality control is a concern, some defective units shipped

customer_reviews.title: I like this tuner over the snark
customer_reviews.text: I like this tuner over the snark, especially for begginers, because it shows you which string you are tuning to, when the tuner is set to "G" (G fo guitar). The way this helps is that, if someone is tuning the A string, the display should show the number 5 on the lower left corner (for 5th string from the bottom). Instead of showing G#, G, F#, F if it's too low, or A#, B, C C#, etc, if it's too high, it will simply show that you are too low or too high. Again, something that beginners might struggle with, since their ears are not tuned to what the notes should sound like.
customer_reviews.author: AG82

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, this damaged the guitar.
customer_reviews.text: Toxic. After a few weeks, this caused a permanent mark on a genuine 1972 telecaster. Best guess is; corrosive chemical outgassing from cheap materials. Fortunately, the guitar is heavily worn so it's another battle scar... Thanks for the toxic junk, fender!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Benway

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've been working with this tuner for a couple of months now (of course the return window closed) - on several occasions, I tuned the bass with the tuner, then tuned the strings against each other, with and without harmony, and they were quite a ways off... also sometimes, (in a room, door closed, no other instruments or noises) it first shows the note as being off, then after a while on target...?! Hubby has perfect pitch (envy) and says the tuner is not accurate. Otherwise, easy to use and see, but I need to be tuned correctly. Bought a Snark Super Tight, will see how this one does.
customer_reviews.author: John and Anne

customer_reviews.title: Should only be one mode, Chromatic!
customer_reviews.text: Should only be one mode, Chromatic! Jordan and I recommend that KLIQ make a redesign. We think the Uber Tuner is just too busy with all the graphics where it really does not need to be. I have attached pictures to show how we think the Uber Tuner should work. Yellow = Flat, BLUE = IN TUNE, Red = Sharp. Should power on the device and only have one MODE, Chromatic. If you make these changes, then this would get a 5 star rating every single time. The Principle of parsimony.
customer_reviews.author: JoeteckTips

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I must say this works really Well, was a bit skeptical if it would off the innovation of my guitar since I own an Ibanez but has proven to be efficient and is in sync with the innovation of the guitar, the bottom clamping rubber comes out quickly though but does not destroy the integrity of the guitar on its bare surface. This is my primary tuner so yes full stars
customer_reviews.author: KNIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. The only thing I was a little disappointed was that there is a screw holding the battery cover in place... which is good - but you have to have a very small screw driver to open it. Once that's done - it works great!!!! Very compact unlike some others that stick out and look awkward. Easy to read, even outside (with good battery power). Will use this guy til it breaks or it gets "lost" by my kids, like my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Erika and Thayne

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a poor review but feel I must let others know. I have another fender ft-004 tuner which is fabulous. I order a second one and here is a tiny screw I. The back so there is no way to open to place battery in tuner. The back battery area is designed totally different then my current tuner. If I could give it 0 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and battery EASY to change!  ;-)
customer_reviews.text: Great tuner. Easy to learn and use. Writing mainly because a previous reviewer commented on how difficult it was to change the battery. Extremely small screw, etc. I wonder if this might have been the case at one time? The battery compartment opens with a 1/4 turn of a coin making replacement of the CR2032 battery as easy as can be. I have found free tuner aps for my smart phone that do more, but results are comparable with either and this handly little device is great. Reasonably priced. Highly recommend to other.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: No Roadies, No Problem - Fender tuner makes it easy
customer_reviews.text: The headstock spring clamp is small and low profile but holds very well and the display pivots on two axiis to give good visibility angles on any type of headstock. I have Fender, Gibson, and Schecter guitars and the tuner display is easily adjustable to all of them. The Led display is strongly backlit for minimal lighting conditions such as a club venue, but is still visible in a fully lit area. The display uses high - low indicators for tuning and flashes green when optimum tuning pitch is reached.
customer_reviews.author: J Pierson

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Guitar/Bass tuner
customer_reviews.text: Small simple, easy to read, but, I've lost a small part off of the clip part of one of these, but it still works. If it weren't for that, it would be 5 stars. That being said, it is 5 stars compared to every other tuner I've owned, so, don't hesitate, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: bigbusyfamily

customer_reviews.title: Small cheap good
customer_reviews.text: Loved the price, but it will probably break or get lost fairly soon based on size and the brittle plastic its housed in. Seems accurate enough, my guitar sounds cleaner than when tuned by ear, all my strings were a tad high or low according to this. Hardest part was loading the battery no instructions on +/- side up but you got a 50% chsnce to get it right
customer_reviews.author: Christoph

customer_reviews.title: Solid little tuner...
customer_reviews.text: and I do mean little. It's much smaller than I thought it would be but that's a good thing. The reason I bought it was to tune my mandolin (which hasn't arrived yet). To test it I tuned my Epiphone acoustic that has a built in tuner. This Fender tuner is right on the money. I am confident that I'll be able to accurately tune the mandolin with it. I'm satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Aseff

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had these 15 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had these 15 years ago! This Fender tuner is small, convenient and dead simple to use. Also CHEAP!! I used to play a lot of guitar, I have gotten out of the habit, but recently decided to pick it up again, so I have been trying to update my equipment. This was a nice additional to my toolbox, and so inexpensive that is was an easy choice to hit the buy button. It just clips onto the end of your guitar, hit the on button and you are in business. The auto backlight jumps right in and makes the device easy to read in most any light. Very happy with this purchase and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Had to rig up my own clip after it broke...
customer_reviews.text: The tuner itself works no problem. For the first few months it was burning through batteries quick and then one day it stopped having that problem. The metal clip and rod that holds it in place broke after maybe 2 months and I had to make my own to get it to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you want to be an accurate violin player
customer_reviews.text: Excellent display. I set it to the chromatic mode and keep it on my violin at all times. In chromatic mode when you play accurately, the display will change color from blue to green. This feature enables me to play my songs in high accuracy. I got this clip-on together with a set of four fine tuners. With this clip-on and the four fine tuners, I am able to play violin much more accurately. Having enjoyed it for a few weeks, I found much better deals of same products (at 1/4 price) on ebay. Now I bought many sets as gifts to my friends of my violin class. I wish I had them years ago.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Tune me up, Scotty.  A cheap and easy way to tune the guitar.
customer_reviews.text: This item is cheap in price, is easily used by simply clamping onto the guitar and makes tuning easy. Essentially, you clamp this onto to the guitar and press the button down. Strum the string and you will get a scale that moves into the sweet spot and goes from blue to green when it hits the sweet spot. The screen lights up so you can use this in the dark. I have tested this with my own ear (not so accurate but learning) and with online tuners (pretty darn accurate) and it works. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Narut Ujnat

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. For standard tuning Bass and guitar this thing is fast and easy. The reason for the 4 star has to do with Lag on the low B tuning of a 5 string bass. It does the job. But has a harder time with the slower vibrations of low strings. That being said. Id buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: AlTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Snark
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch of Snark SN-8's a while back when they were 8$ on here. The price went up and I thought I would try this. I prefer the Snark. This requires a small screwdriver to remove a small screw to open the battery compartment The battery compartment won't stay closed without the screw. You have to hold the power button to turn it off. If you just press it it toggles between the different settings (chromatic, guitar, bass, violin). I also think that the Snark has a wider clamp to clamp. Not as nice as a Snark. Small differences in convenience. Tunes well, no issues there. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Dr. B

customer_reviews.title: Fender should be Ashamed
customer_reviews.text: Being an owner of Fender guitars for 25 years, this product does not represent the Fender brand. Its made in China and like most Chinese products, VERY poorly made. The battery cover is the typical "coin" slot removal, however a US quarter does not contact the edged surfaces to enable removal. The cover is damaged just trying to get the battery out. Initial problem is that after a few weeks it stopped recognizing anything below the low E. Replaced the battery and still the same problem. Its very cheap any don't waste your money on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bakay

customer_reviews.title: I got a lemon.  Maybe you won’t.
customer_reviews.text: Mine was not accurate, jumps all around. And I have years of experience with tuners. I don’t even use it anymore. I like the looks and built and size, just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: terryg

customer_reviews.title: NOT Fender quality - this product needs a tune-up
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. Maybe I just got a lemon, but it is completely useless. It typically doesn't respond at all to the instrument it's connected to. When it does pick up a note, it generally doesn't stay locked onto it long enough to tune the string. I have a couple of Snark tuners for my guitars and a couple of clip-on ukelele tuners and even an electronic tuner I bought more than 30 years ago, and they all work fine, so I'm plenty familiar with the technology. I see several Amazon reviews that look like others are having the same issues I've had. I'm surprised Fender puts its name on a product that seems prone to failure.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Durbin

customer_reviews.title: great tuner, can be slow to respond to frequency changes
customer_reviews.text: great tuner, can be slow to respond to frequency changes, once you get used to it all is good. It is EXTREMELY easy to read with a Green Display. I use it on my acoustic axes
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Hill

customer_reviews.title: Works well, priced right
customer_reviews.text: This Fender tuner is easy to use and accurate for tuning my guitar. It works just fine for tuning the open strings. It does not work well enough for checking intonation since it won't pick up the vibrations of fretted strings. The display is fully adjustable so it's easy to see from any position. The display is bright in any light condition, it glows green when the string is in tune. I did need to select the "G" guitar function for it to work correctly; with the default "C" chromatic function is was more difficult to use. Thankfully it remains as set, "G", the next time it's used. To summarize, it works as expected for a very cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: It's only OK.
customer_reviews.text: This tuner seems to favor a tad sharp versus other tuners I own. It also takes longer to register the string before it shows the tuning result (I'd say a full second delay from when you pluck the string until you see the result). It's lightweight and easy to carry, and tunes a variety of stringed instruments including ukulele. I use an app on my phone more often than this tuner, but I do like this tuner for when I'm in an area where I can't rely on the microphone (with music/talking in the background).
customer_reviews.author: Truck Spank

customer_reviews.title: Fender FT-004 Chromatic Clip-On Tuner
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived a few days ahead of the guitar I'd purchased, so I was unable to use & review it until now. I have used a tuner in the past, but not a chromatic one like this. The FT-004 is extremely easy to use, and also very accurate. I like the fact that the LED display glows green when the string is at the proper pitch, and the display is very easy to read, even in low light. The FT-004 can also be left on the instrument while playing (it doesn't get in the way at all, nor does it add any weight). This is a very handy, easy-to-use, accurate and (best of all) inexpensive tuner.
customer_reviews.author: 240Brick

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good product but comes without a lithium battery so no big deal... wrong! Try finding a Phillips head small enough! I had a few from my computer assembly days and they barely fit.
customer_reviews.author: PLH

customer_reviews.title: (Not for 5 String basses).Have on hand an eyeless screwdriver and great eyes 😳
customer_reviews.text: I JUST got mine in and after spending FOREVER trying to get the thing open to put the battery in (not even putting that little stew back in there), it is not working for my 5 string bass 😡
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Not terribly sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: Not terribly sensitive. You could not use this on a stage to tweak the tuning in a set. You have to use a pick and pluck the string pretty firmly. Accurate in tuning but I had to pluck the string pretty hard to get the scale to read. Can't fuss about the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I've had a freestanding tuner that I've had for years, worked great but had to balance it on my knee, LOL, this is so much smaller and convenient, LOVE IT !
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Wolf

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the fact that I must remove the battery after ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the fact that I must remove the battery after I've used it. I put new strings on a guitar and used the tuner for the first time. It worked great! The next day I wanted to re-tune the guitar because of "new string stretch" and the tuner would not turn on! I had an extra battery so I replaced it then the tuner would turn on. The next day I just thought I would turn it on and once again it would not turn on until I replaced the battery again. So now I have to leave the battery cover off and remove the battery after each use. Other than that bit of pain it works good!
customer_reviews.author: Randall Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Tunes My Cello, Viola, And Violin !
customer_reviews.text: This Little Tuner Works Super Well With My Cello, Viola, And Violin! I Haven't Had A Moment's Trouble With It. I Read The Other Reviews About The Head, So, I Knew I Would Be Careful With It. I Rarely Have To Swivel The Head On It. For What I Am Using It For, It More Than Met My Expectations. It Is Exceptional For The Price! Perfect To Clamp On The Bridges Of The Aforementioned Stringed Instruments And Have Them In Tune Quickly. Wonderful To Have On Hand, And If It Ever Dies, I Shall Not Hesitate To Replace It With Another One Like It! I Would Recommend It To Others. . . .
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: This a great tuner for any kind of string player. I love it and it is super convenient
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for more 5 months now and it never disappoints. I am the bass player for my church worship band, and my tuner gets shared amongst the guitarist because it is so great. I also play saxophone for church and it works just as great on that too. Recommended for musicians everywhere, bedroom players, gigging pros, it doesn't matter this tuner is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: christopher reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuner
customer_reviews.text: Great little tuner. Keep it in my bag for when I go to lessons. Clips right on and you will be in tune and playing within minutes! Got this one because it works off of vibration. Means you can tune without needing your amp plugged in, and you can also tune in a room where 5 other people are playing at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Chad K.

customer_reviews.title: In Tune
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tuner. No reason to play out of tune with one of these laying around. Very easy to use and read while tuning.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Rider

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, small subtle tuner
customer_reviews.text: My favorite tuner, this is the 4th one I have bought; I wanted one in every room. Love these as they work well, are subtle black color, has easy to read display, which turns all green when pitch is hit. Has the lovely Fender logo on it. Does chromatic tuning - a must for all the "open tunings" I use on my KME guitar tunes. Also this tuner is small, easy to fit on headstocks, or the end piece of my arch-top. Get one, you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mark Eberhart

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, I'd buy it again if needed.
customer_reviews.text: They are small, compact, easy to carry on instruments without it getting on the way (easy to lose too). I got this because I lost my first one. These are great string instrument tuners although the battry kinda dies a bit faster than expected but it still lasts at least 3 whole months before it is time to replace it again.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Rosas

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: While this is no frills it is now at a great price. This is the third of these I have bought (multiple guitars) and I have been consistently satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Stockdale

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for what it is. So very grateful that we were able to find a cheap enough product to overcome the weeks of me yelling,"Why the hell don't you tune that thing?" to more or less actually hearing it in tune. Next step is to put a couple more strings on the guitar!
customer_reviews.author: J. Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: It works great if you pay attention
customer_reviews.text: These are great and compact, I have one in every guitar case, and one clipped to my music stand . Some bad reviews are because people don't pay attention and make sure the tuner is set for the instrument they are tuning, if you make sure there is a G in the screen when you are tuning a guitar then you are good to go. The display turns green when you are in tune. I clamped this on the headstock and compared it with my name brand name pedal chromatic and it was dead on. I have absolutely no complaints, especially for a tuner that costs less than $10.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Bizzell

customer_reviews.title: Stringed instrament tuner
customer_reviews.text: A basic string vibration tuner. It picks up the strings vibration letting you know if your in tune or not. I have 2 of them, one in each instrument bag.
customer_reviews.author: S. Paczer

customer_reviews.title: Good for all instrument tuning
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best. Forget Snark and all the rest. This has capabilities to be set to tune a variety of instruments. It's quick and easy and works very well. When the right note is found it's green. Takes the guesswork out of tuning. I use it to tune my bass, violin, ukulele, and my 6 string guitars. It even has a chromatic setting for other tuning - such as drop down or alternative tuning on a guitar. I like this so much I bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Holley

customer_reviews.title: Only OK. Will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: It's not super sensitive and therefore not super accurate. The gap between almost perfect and perfect is relatively big. Even if it lights up dead center green you can still screw with the turners ever so little and it is still green. It's also relatively "clumsy". I have a feeling it's only a matter of time before the clip or something breaks. I use it only as a back up. Thinking about giving it to a student.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Family

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because of the price. However my guitar beginner daughter has used it many times on her own and it works great! I have a good ear for things being out of tune, and I can tell when she hits the correct notes with this tuner. It is very easy to use, and clips easily onto her acoustic guitar.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Mullaney

customer_reviews.title: Can't Believe I Didn't Have Something Like This Before Now
customer_reviews.text: A clip-on tuner! What a concept! I have been playing guitar for 14 years and was always using either a basic tuner or my smartphone (as of late). This is such a better experience. Always there, always accurate. Touch it on when you need it and then you're good to go. Display is beautiful and displays green when you are in tune. Also is a great learning tool for someone trying to learn notes along a guitar fret! I often catch myself leaving it on and training myself on the notes just by playing them going down the fretboard. Awesome tuner, would have paid double what they're asking.
customer_reviews.author: Nick LaFazia

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuner
customer_reviews.text: I just love it, it is practical, reliable, easy to use, and affordable. Light with a small size, You can put it in your pocket. Remember you need a tiny screwdriver (the same size as the ones you'd use to tighten glasses'screws) to insert the delivered battery into place. Not that easy..Morever, you need to know how such a tuner functions because if not, the user manuals is inexistant, so go and surf internet for more info. If you are familiar with such a tool then this tuner works great!
customer_reviews.author: VeroTop Contributor: Drawing

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Worked for lower tuned strings but not for the higher pitched ones. Even had our son’s music teacher try to see if they could get it to work. They could not.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Makes tuning quick and painless
customer_reviews.text: My previous tuners had a plugin for an electric guitar as well as a mic for an acoustic. Both inputs worked...okay...but wasn't very accurate and gave a lot of false readings. This clip-on is by far the easiest tuner that I've ever used. The meter is quick and stable, and makes tuning quick and painless. I can't compare the Fender to other tuners of this type, but compared to the other types, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Scrooge

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for three months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clip-on tuner and an intellitouch capo tuner as well. The capo tuner is a bit more bulky and has to be relocated when tuning the G string. This Fender tuner is nice and light, got good reviews and worked well for three months. I thought the battery died because I couldn't see anything when I turned it on, but it was the backlighting that quit. When a string is in tune, the green light comes on, but without back lighting you can't tell which way to go. I checked the battery and it is fine. I may try another Fender one, or maybe I'll just get used to the capo tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Rock N Roller

customer_reviews.title: Quick & easy to use tuner.
customer_reviews.text: This tuner is so easy to use. Since I'm not that great at tuning by ear, I use this tuner to make sure I am in tune. It's quick to use & small enough for storing. The display swivels so that you can move it around to make it easy for you to see. I think this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: MAGS7964Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Works well and very affordable
customer_reviews.text: The tuner works very well. Although the screen doesn't pivot 360 degrees it's not difficult to position the clip on my guitar headstock in order to view the screen. The On/Off button is also easy to use once you understand how it works. The tuner is designed for multiple instruments. A quick push of the button does not turn the tuner off, instead it switches to a different instrument. You have to push and hold the button for a couple of seconds to turn it off - no problem. Given the price I can afford to put one in every instrument case.
customer_reviews.author: Victek

customer_reviews.title: I must have got a bad one. It simply doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I must have got a bad one. This thing has many good reviews, yet mine simply does not work at all. It did once or twice. It lights up but its like it thinks while the guitar is ringing, then it displays nothing. I changed battery but there was no change. I need a reliable tuner. This didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a dud
customer_reviews.text: Rarely get a bad product from Amazon. I know this product gets good reviews but the one I got was a dud. Doesn't wake up when it hears a string being played. It has been really hit and miss to get it to tune anything. My other tuners are excellent, and about the same price. Not a big loss as it was pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Don Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: excellent tuner, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little tuner. I bought two for the band at church to have for whatever instrument is at hand (if they didn't have one already), and liked it so much I bought another one for home for my boys to use with their cello or violin. I'll probably be buying more in the future, and it's the tuner I'm recommending to my team whenever someone asks.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: So simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this tool, I have an acoustic guitar and was using a whistle-type tuner. NOT ANYMORE!, This "Fender"electronic tuner is superb for my needs. The tone differences of the guitar between the two types of tuners I now have is no comparison.. I recommend this Fender tuner to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Januszewski

customer_reviews.title: it's small but it works
customer_reviews.text: It works as described, I used it on an electric guitar that wasn't plugged in and it worked just fine. And from previous reviews, I knew others said it was small, but I was still shocked as to how small it really is. I would like it bigger, but I guess if you have limited space in a guitar carrier, this small could be a good thing
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I play a lot of guitar but being a little hard of hearing it is difficult for me to tune my various guitars. I tried this and it is great- I used it on 6 string and my electric and 12 string. Very easy even an amature like me can use it- turn the key up ot down until the screen turns Green and you got it. Move onto the next string. I've since bought a second one for the garage where I play the electric and another for when I play the 6 string in the bedroom. So easy and so good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chancellor

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tuner
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me, it does the job whether practice or gigging, neat little gadget, thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my little tuner
customer_reviews.text: I have another tuner that I have owned for a long time that still works, but this is the only tuner I use anymore. I clip it to my bass guitar and don't need any sound out of the bass to tune it. It does it in a silent mode. This helps when I'm playing at a concert. And the price is great $8.00, what a deal. It also tunes guitar's banjo's violins and I think one more. You can't go wrong and it's so small only I know it's there, and it ready to work whenever I need it. I would recomend it to anyone who plays a string instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Kirchoff

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: great item, great price, gotta love new technology. accurate for electric and acoustic guitar, makes tuning so easy. an in-tune guitar is fun and pleasant to play, improves practice. padded clip so far has not marked headstock. LED display is very bright, not so responsive as old type meter tuners in that the string needs to be plucked continuously, but once you get used to that, well worth the convenience of not having to use a guitar cord .
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota Designer

customer_reviews.title: I like to keep things as simple as possible with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I play in a duo where I play acoustic/electric guitar. Compared to the full band I play in where I use a floor pedal with a tuner in it, I like to keep things as simple as possible with the duo. The Fender tuner works great, the way it flashes bright green when my tuning is right on is great. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Harris

customer_reviews.title: Chromatic as well as by instrument
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the instrument letter in lower right corner. It's chromatic as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bald Eagle Music Education Station

customer_reviews.title: Great tuna
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple, easy to use tuner that does what its supposed to do. I've used it for a guitar (standard & open tuned), Irish bazouki, oud, bass, dulcimer, autoharp & it worked for them all. The swivel allows you to agle it for optimum visability. The display is big & bright enough to see in daylight. I used it at an outdoor gig & had no trouble seeing it. All this comes with a very attractive price point. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple tuners but I find this one the easiest to use by far. I'm just a beginner ukulele player so I don't need anything fancy, just simple and quick.
customer_reviews.author: EnduroDriver

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought a Uke, and it had one of this type of tuners included. I loved it so bought one for myself. So much more convenient with the clip than a stand-alone unit. Very accurate and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Craig V. I.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift and loved it so much I kept it for myself
customer_reviews.author: Maria Majiros

customer_reviews.title: excellent!
customer_reviews.text: It is tiny, precise and easy to read from my Fender P-Bass headstock. It glows blue when you are off tone, and shifts to bright green when you hit the "sweet spot". Has settings for bass, guitar, and violin.The only thing I dont like is that it doesnt have a universal swivel, as it only rotates on only two axis, but hey for $10 you cant have it all! This little wonder is the best one I have seen for small size, ease of use and readability! I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Hozer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working suddenly after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use the tuner has stopped working. It will still turn on, but it doesn't pick up any of the sound waves from the instrument. It has lasted longer than any other tuner I have had so that was a plus, but I've found my tuner app on my phone to be more reliable since it quit working so suddenly. (I don't think I was particularly rough on it either, I just clipped it on my ukulele to tune and kept it in the case the rest of the time)
customer_reviews.author: Chella13

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little tuner. It's not bulky like my other brands. Love that it's backlit and easy to see. Pretty close to accurate. Just a small warning......the screw that secures the battery compartment lid is as tiny as an eyeglass screw. It is also black. I lost mine in 30 seconds, never to be found in the nap of the carpet. ;) Had to dig up another micro screw and dabbed it with a drop of yellow paint. My bad.
customer_reviews.author: JDH

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first time and quit.  :-(
customer_reviews.text: This tuner worked great the first time but a few hours later, It's WAY off. A little expensive for a one time tuning. :-( I wish I could get my money back or try another if this one was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C. Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use tuner
customer_reviews.text: Tuning has always been a challenge for me, and this tuner is a tremendous help. It clips easily to the top of my mandolin, and the blue screen changes to green when the string is in tune. Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: L. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: It works...Thank you
customer_reviews.text: To shoot and circulate; smiles have there been seen Tranquil assurances that Heaven supports The feeble motions of thy life, and cheers 70 Thy loneliness: or shall those smiles be called Feelers of love, put forth as if to explore This untried world, and to prepare thy way Through a strait passage intricate and dim? Such are they; and the same are tokens, signs, Which, when the appointed season hath arrived, Joy, as her holiest language, shall adopt; And Reason's godlike Power be proud to own. 1804.
customer_reviews.author: A D Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool little device
customer_reviews.text: I have been using an app on my cell phone until I purchased this from Amazon. This thing is awesome. It's so cool that you just clip it from guitar to guitar and not have to worry about plugging anything in to it. Oh and it turns itself off after 60 seconds of no sound. It does get a little sensitive when tuning, in the sense of that it is easy to go past your mark. But the more I use it, the better feel I get for it. If you don't have one, get one.
customer_reviews.author: Semiproslacker

customer_reviews.title: One Star would Be too Extreme... but I wanted to!
customer_reviews.text: One star would be too extreme because technically it does work. But this is the worst cheap little tuner that I have ever had. It doesn't read well at all. I have had a few Snark® Tuners and those are million times better than this one. If it tells you what note you're playing it does not seem to pick and of the increments. For the price get the Snark instead. I've used those and they work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Muscle Souls

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, great tuner but one limitation.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others. This tuner is great at what it does, accurately. A lot can be said of the vibration tuning method. However, I am a bit surprised that no review I have read address the alternate tuning option limitation. As a guitar player, it excels at giving me tuning for the 6 opens strings in standard tuning. However, it does not support anything but standard tuning. No tuning half a step down, Drop D, double Drop D (Neil Young anyone?). That said, the tuner is bright and can be read in nearly all light condition (although I haven't tried it in direct sunlight). The battery life seems great and it is fully adjustable to just about any headstock.
customer_reviews.author: M & E's Pop

customer_reviews.title: Verdi tile tunner
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to use and read. I love the fact it has multiple settings for guitars, violins, Ukuleles, bass is a plus
customer_reviews.author: Job Santos

customer_reviews.title: Really good tuner. Perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: Really good tuner. Perfect size for me. Display is easy to read. I couldn’t get it to work on the Banjo setting when helping a friend tune his banjo, but since all I use it for is guitar anyway, works great!
customer_reviews.author: A.C.

customer_reviews.title: Love how easy it is to use this tuner
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty amazing how easily this thing works. Unlike my other tuner which needs the room to be quiet so that it can hear my acoustic, this tuner clips on to the head stock and tunes in a noisy room (a must have with a house full of kids running around...haha). The tuner also can change settings between chromatic, guitar, bass, ukulele...Which is great because we just purchased a Ukulele and not used to the tuning yet. This tuner makes it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This tuner is great. I recommend it to all of my friends. Small for storage and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Small, accurate, inexpensive; what else could you ask for?!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of my old "hooter" tuner; this is an excellent replacement! Works exactly as specified, is quite accurate, and is easy to mount. It's not very big, so it won't detract from my playing, either!
customer_reviews.author: KennyG

customer_reviews.title: The packaging on this tuner was outstanding. This tuner ...
customer_reviews.text: The packaging on this tuner was outstanding. This tuner is adequate for basic tuning of a guitar, even to the point for completely changing strings. However, I tried to use it for setting the intonation and did not work as well. The instruction sheet was lacking in any specific information. The price was cheap compared to other tuners I have used in the past. I think cheap is the operative word.
customer_reviews.author: Errol F. Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well and quickly
customer_reviews.text: Use this on an acoustic electric guitar and it seems to work quite well.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Guitar Micro-Tuner
customer_reviews.text: This tuner responses quickly and accurately for tuning the guitar. Fender continues to live up to its name. Thanks! LTS
customer_reviews.author: LTS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a quick banjo tuning
customer_reviews.text: This tuner was much smaller than I anticipated since I have never used these types of tuners before but the form factor was great. I use it for my banjo and it works great. So easy to sit down, tune quick, and get right down to picking. I leave it on all the time since it is not in the way at all.
customer_reviews.author: luke

customer_reviews.title: Probably don’t go cheap buying one
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get battery in , took me about 20 mins to figure it out. Light comes on to tune guitar whe it feels like it. Not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Curry

customer_reviews.title: It works "ok", but is very s-l-o-w to react to note changes.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, mounts well on my Ukulele, but is s-l-o-w registering note changes. I have two other brand tuners on two other Ukes and both are quick and positive. I'll keep using this one for a while to see if it straightens out, but I'm pretty sure I'll get one of the other two brands I have as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Wolff

customer_reviews.title: It can Tuna Fish
customer_reviews.text: Borrowed one from a fellow guitarist. So, I knew what to expect. I learned that it is for more than just guitar (chromatic, guitar, bass, & drawing a blank). It works off of vibration and matches the tones of the other guys. I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Givens

customer_reviews.title: NICE TO HAVE
customer_reviews.text: Easy to see easy to use just leave it on the head stock all the time.Now that I have one I see them every where even on TV .locks in quick on a note I used to use a floor or pedal tuner but at 47 years old I cant see the letters of the notes or flats and sharps when its way down on the floor anymore.On my electric guitar no need to turn up the volume or plug in it senses the vibrations so you can tune quietly.
customer_reviews.author: Dantastic

customer_reviews.title: the best tuner out there
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, the best tuner out there. Love that it can be set to instrument being tuned so no question as to which string you are tuning for a given instrument. Can also be set to "C" instruments to tune anything. Very accurate and easy to ease. Haven't seen anyone with a better one when going open mike events. WELL satisfied
customer_reviews.author: w83

customer_reviews.title: Died after four months.
customer_reviews.text: This tuner worked fine for about four months, and then failed. New battery didn't fix the problem. Warranty is 90 days, so I guess I'm out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Offer

customer_reviews.title: Great for what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Great for what you pay for, but it will only do the "standard" tunings (EADGBE for guitar). I wish it had alternative tunings, like drop-d, e-flat, open chord, etc. I guess you have to pay extra for those features, but that seems kind of silly. If the Rockstar game can do it, why can't this? Seems like lazy coding, but no other tuner at this price does it yet, either. guess they all use the same mfr. Can't comment on accuracy - seems ok to me but I don't have crazy-accurate tonal ears. Lightweight, easy to use. I just leave it on the guitar most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Casey

customer_reviews.title: WON'T TUNE HIGHER OCTAVE!
customer_reviews.text: It works well and the fact that you can tune multiple instruments is awesome, however the one issue i have is that it WILL NOT 'HEAR' NOTES FROM A HIGHER OCTAVE, at least not on the guitar setting. so trying to use this to set intonation is impossible since it won't read 12th fret notes. Kinda lame, I had to pull out my huge cheapie ancient tuner, which worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: javan

customer_reviews.title: Love that it works for both my ukulele and guitar
customer_reviews.text: I find it really easy to use and accurate. Definitely would recommend it, especially to those who play multiple instruments. I specifically got this particular tuner because I have started playing ukulele (I used to only play piano and guitar), and was sad that my guitar tuner I had at that time didn't have all the ukulele's standard tuning pitches on it. But this does the trick and can me modified to work for all your different instrument tuning needs!
customer_reviews.author: Kari Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great, until it breaks.
customer_reviews.text: I have now gone through two of these. When they work, they are fantastic. Unfortunately the electronics in both of mine have died after a few months. The first time I thought it was just a fluke, but my second tuner is now continuously flashing random screen segments whenever I turn it on. I tried replacing the battery but that didn't help. I'm going to give the Snark tuner a try. Maybe I will have better luck with that.
customer_reviews.author: Sagebrush Gardener

customer_reviews.title: ... imagine doing lessons or prepping for practice without this wonderful tool. It's spot on and has lasted me ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't imagine doing lessons or prepping for practice without this wonderful tool. It's spot on and has lasted me for quite a while. It still works wonderfully and I've had it since starting lessons back in October.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Moore

customer_reviews.title: This would be a perfectly priced great little tuner (they work great)
customer_reviews.text: This would be a perfectly priced great little tuner (they work great) , except for a very-tiny screw in the back for battery installation ! Good luck, even with the smallest of screwdrivers or alum wrenches getting that screw loose , and then without stripping the damned thing while trying to get it loose ! Whoever came up with that design is an idiot !
customer_reviews.author: D. Stover

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: You can get a tuner on your phone but this one is better. I tuned it with my phone then with this one and the difference is noted. With my phone the guitar sounded like rubbing a fork on a plate. With the tuner it sounded like heaven. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: For Beginners or Pros...It Is Great
customer_reviews.text: This item is absolutely great in every way...it is so small that you could put it in your shirt pocket with ease. It just clips onto the neck (not on the strings) and picks up the vibrations and shows them either sharp, flat, or in tune...you just have to set it up for the instrument that you are trying to tune...guitar, bass, or uke...gonna give it to a couple of beginners and I do not forsee any difficulties..
customer_reviews.author: Virginina Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Able to tune guitar. the display is also good. Not sure about the battery, working at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to see and use, it even changes color when you're in tune. One tiny complaint: the one button serves both as on/off and select different tunings. It's too easy to push the button and accidentally choose a different tuning, which can really mess you up until you realize why it's telling you to radically tighten the string. Just have to check the screen to see that it's in the right tuning mode.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Samedi

customer_reviews.title: Having problems with high strings on banjo
customer_reviews.text: I'm having some trouble. I'm trying to tune my new banjo (played guitar for many years so i am familiar with the procedure). It doesn't want to pick up string 1 and 2 (B and D). I have it set to B for banjo and even tuned it with an app and still nothing is registering. Did i receive a deaf tuner?
customer_reviews.author: phillip wolfert

product_meta.title: Fender California Series Clip-On Tuner - Candy Apple Red
product_meta.description:
Style:California| Color:Red

View larger View larger FENDER CALIFORNIA SERIES CLIP-ON TUNER - CANDY APPLE RED
Fender's California Series Chromatic Tuner conveniently powers on automatically as soon as it is attached to the headstock of a guitar or bass. The compact tuner's vibration-sensing capabilities let players tune easily and accurately in any performance situation, and its bright LCD screen is ideal for the darkest stages. An easy-to-read needle displays green when in tune but changes color to indicate sharp or flat notes. The California Series Tuner is available in eye-catching Candy Apple Red and Lake Placid Blue.


ABOUT FENDER
With an illustrious history dating back to 1946, Fender has touched and transformed music worldwide and in nearly every genre: rock ‘n’ roll, country and western, jazz, rhythm and blues and many others. Everyone from beginners and hobbyists to the world’s most acclaimed artists and performers have used Fender instruments and amps, in the process making the company not only a revered music industry name, but also a cultural icon. It is our vision to continue championing the spirit of rock-n-roll throughout the world, and our mission to exceed the expectations of music enthusiasts worldwide.


FEATURES
 * Tuning Range: A (27.5Hz)-C (4186Hz)
 * Mode: Chromatic
 * Precision +/- 1 cent
 * A4 Range: 440Hz
 * Power Supply: 3V (CR2032) Lithium Battery (included)
 * Color: Candy Apple Red
